Thanks Zack.=C2=A0 So how do you see not asking it questions squaring with =
Frank's comment of "It's not the device, it's the user. The messages receiv=
ed are for the
user, and rarely does anyone hear the same thing as the orig=
inal
listener."

Does that mean two people can't use it together?=C2=A0 How=
 would they know which the message was for if they do?=C2=A0 Or is it best =
to only use it alone?


--- On Thu, 1/7/10, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...=
> wrote:

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Wha=
t does it do?
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thursday, January 7, 2010, =
10:40 AM







=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      I don't think any o=
f us know really who or what the "entities" are. They have told a few peopl=
e who they are, but given the propensity of some to lie, who knows?
=C2=A0
=
I also believe you do not need to ask any questions at all - just let the b=
ox run and listen to what comes out, maybe record it at the same time so yo=
u can replay it later.
=C2=A0
Zack


On Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 12:10 PM, Rj <r=
asterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 







Perhaps I am not being clear.=
=C2=A0 I am not asking how it works.=C2=A0 I am asking what you claim it do=
es.

For example, from your statements below, I get:

"The Frank's box allo=
ws entities to use FM and AM radio broadcast as raw material, which these e=
nties select and shape to communicate with the user.=C2=A0 The messages rec=
eived are for the user, and rarely does anyone hear the same thing as the o=
riginal listener."


Can you be any more specific as to what you mean by 'e=
ntities'?
Also, can the user be defined as the person asking the box questi=
ons?




--- On Thu, 1/7/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wr=
ote:



From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] What does it do? 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Thursday, Janua=
ry 7, 2010, 9:35 AM 



=C2=A0 


=C2=A0It's a freaking radio!=C2=A0 The tu=
ning is swept across the entire band, AM or FM, the resulting bits of speec=
h, music, and noise are used by the enitites as a raw material to build the=
ir voices from. The sweep can be linear, random, or manual, and it does not=
 have to cover the entire broadcast band. This is one method and device for=
 providing the raw audio, and if you're tesitng to see if it's just broadca=
st fragments, consider this-the concept is the same as EVPmaker, EVPmaker r=
uns on a computer, the entities manipulate that raw audio inside the conmpu=
ter, and if you think stray RF=C2=A0is going to get inside the hard drive a=
nd mix with=C2=A0the audio file you have no clue how any technology works. =


=C2=A0
=C2=A0Testing is irrelavent! It's not the device, it's the user. T=
he messages received are for the user, and rarely does anyone hear the same=
 thing as the original listener. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0You test it by use, y=
ou judge it by what comes through and what it means to you, you can't play =
the sound snipets to a panel of numbnuts(objective listeners)) and expect t=
o get an unbiased/honest test. No two people hear the same, so an "objectiv=
e listener" is an insult to most people doing this work.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I kn=
ow, I'm being harsh.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S


On Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 8:20 AM,=
 rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 




Hey all, I've seen lot=
s of people posting their perspectives and results and such about the Frank=
's Box. In order to help develop some good testing for it, I think the firs=
t step is to get a common or official consensus or statement on what it is =
the Frank's Box is claiming to be doing. This might seem a silly question, =
but I think it's important to make sure any testing doesn't go off in some =
irrevelevant direction.


Frank - or anyone - what is a good official state=
ment on what the Frank's box can do?









    
     

    
    


 



=
